reviews.review: The most fun you can have online. Ever.
Definitely one of the games of all time

The game is pretty varied thanks to its amount of interesting maps, which offer plenty of advantage points, shortcuts and in general different layouts for you to move around. The game offers 9 characters who all play completely differently but the game remains balanced in casual matches. Except not really, since these days, the game is unfortunately full of sniper bots that can one shot you literally anytime they want.
Although the characters aren't all necessarily balanced when in 1v1 combat, the gameplay is more about your positioning and your role, for example Medic is gonna be more useful powering up tank characters rather than doing damage himself. 
The game's visual style is unique and colorful, contrasting interestingly with its occasional brutality. The characters' designs and expressions are all well animated and give characters some personality.
Sounddesign is exceptional here, each weapon sounds great and all the characters have at least some amount of voice acting, which is always well made and sounds very over the top, which fits this game well and the music is pretty good too.
Thanks to community's work with all the new game modes and maps, new content comes out pretty much all the time, so the game never stops offering its players new experiences.
Since it's free and it's from Valve, it's full of lootboxes that you can only open with keys you have to pay real money for. Fortunately, the rewards are either just skins, taunts and other visual changes, or equipment which always has both advantages and disadvantages, so usually, you won't have a clear advantage over other players so the game doesn't become pay2win. You also get the chests for achievements, meaning you get at least something for playing the game well and overcoming various, specific challenges. 
Team Fortress 2 is a terrific game, well balanced, endlessly replayable and still has a huge playerbase and is a must-play for any and all MP FPS fans.

Um clássico que com certeza você deveria ter na sua biblioteca Steam.
O jogo em em sua essência é ótimo, muito divertido para jogar sozinho ou com amigos.

[h1]✔️ Pontos Positivos:[/h1]

• Diversos [b]mapas[/b] e [b]modos[/b] de jogo.
• Ótimo [b]balanceamento[/b] considerando o número de equipamentos disponíveis (100+) para cada mercenário.
• [b]HATS![/b]

[h1]⛔ Pontos Negativos:[/h1]

• Contas [b]F2P[/b] (free-to-play) [u]não possuem acesso ao chat por texto ou VoIP[/u].
Esta restrição também se aplica a lista de comandos para as falas dos personagens durante o jogo. 
Caso você precise avisar ao seu time que há Spies por perto (X+2) ou chamar por um Medic para lhe curar (E), será necessário comprar algo dentro da loja do jogo (Loja Mann Co.).
• [b]Cheaters[/b] vem dominando os servidores (principalmente em partidas casuais).
• Sem [b]Updates[/b] significativos (armas, mapas ou novos eventos) há anos.

O Team Fortress 2 é bom, a Valve o corrompe.

So i think its fair to say that after playing this game for over 700 hours, its time for my review on the game. I first downloaded the game from steam as it was a cool looking game with a cartoony artstyle which at the time was amazing to me. As i had played this game, i started to realize that its great, its fun, and its got a somewhat easy to learn/ hard to master  class thing going on, i loved this game when i first downloaded it, and i still do now, but the community is a whole other story. So for anyone looking to get a game that doesnt cost money, easy to learn, has the capability for you to have hours of fun, and just all around great, this is the game for you

Great Game.

Valve have been working on Team Fortress 2 for 6.25 years now, and anticpation is running high after their last game. Let's take a look at the final version of their take on the burgeoning FPS genre.

Well, it's no Half Life 3 but Team Fortress 2 promises that Valve level of quality that they somehow have developed. Have we mentioned how much we'd just prefer this to be Half Life 3?


You already know what to expect from Team Fortress 2 after the last game in the series, and Valve doesn't offer any surprises. There's some new stuff, some irratiting bugs have been ironed out, and a new storyline bolted on to make everything look welcoming for newcomers.

Set in a wartorn part of the world, the game hands you the task of shooting all the terrorists before they shoot you. Some of them are tougher than others. Some need to be shot in the head or the leg before they die. Over the course of the game you will have the choice of over 12 weapons and your character has a great beard.





Team Fortress 2 tries to seperate itself from the pack with interesting features. Team Fortress 2 was designed mainly as an online experience and it's pretty easy to set up and play. The game automatically logs in to the required server and all you need to do is find some other like minded players to join in the fun with. Enemy AI is strong, but come on, who plays solo these days? Multiplayer is a breeze to get going, and playing against another human is always a far sight more challenging than your PC could ever be.


Some people may bemon the lack of co-op play, but this reviewer believes it would have caused ludonarrative dissonance.


From the moment the impressively lit intro scenes start you know you're in for something special, and the actual game doesn't disappoint at all.
Additionally, there is no faulting the environments on display. It's a testament to the graphical prowress of that hot new graphics card you bought for an exhorbitant amount when its in the hands of the experienced team at Valve.

The 3D world of Team Fortress 2 comes to life in a cartoony way, which is nice if you're a fan of the genre.The visuals represent the objects they represent well.

Performance is best on a Nvidia system, and you'll need at least a 5500 card to be able to run the game at the now-standard 768 by 594 resolution with full AA and trilinear mimap interpolation. It's another feather in the PC gaming's cap. Valve have done an impressive job of carrying over what made the console versions so great, not to mention adding a feast of new features and effects designed to make your mouth water and your mouse hand twitch with excitement. Not just anyone can indulge in this kaleidoscopic menagerie of dino blasting, though - this party is for owners of the latest cards only.
Game of the Year contender? Maybe!



Overall Score: 10 / 10

Team Fortress 2 is still worth your time after all these years. The gameplay is easy to pick up, but provides endless rewards for those who dedicate time towards learning the game's many mechanics. Tf2 bursts with personality from the moment you start a round and see everyone doing terrible workout videos, to the random friendly you'll encounter once in a while. Tf2 is easily my favorite fps of all-time.
I would like everyone to play this it's so competitive and so lovely!

Zdechla gra jesli masz ochote pograc w gre, w ktorej jest 60k graczy gdzie 40k to cheaterzy i grifferzy, 10 to boty a reszta to gracze, ktorzy chca normalnie pograc w ta gre. Valve ma wywalone jajca na ta gre nie robila zadnej aktualizacji, ktora by cos zmienila. Jesli chcesz zagrac na pubach/ serverach mozna spodziewac sie tylko tego ze bedzie tam moze 3 osoby, ktore graja w nia tylko dlatego ze nowsze gry nie ida na ich komputerach. I NIE nie wyzywam graczy tej gry bo przeciez kazdy lubi co innego, ale jesli mial bym wrocic do tej gry to bym nie wytrzymal grajac z takimi debilami. Ta gra jest opluta przez valve, anticheata, graczy. Jedynym sposobem aby sie fajnie pobawic w tej grze jest gra ze znajomymi ev manapy czy jak to sie tam nazywa.

I used to spend a lot of my time on this game, making a few friends and overall enjoyed the game and  I definitely recommend it, and there are many roles to choose from, whether it's sitting at the back or hiding behind enemy lines there's always something to choose from, whatever your play style.

I never really understood the achievement item system, in where you would unlock better items, for doing certain tasks, but at my age then, I never really looked into it properly, some games would seem slow others would fly by, but either way it is a great game for it being free.

On top of this there is over 500 achievements to keep you having something to do, being an achievement hunter myself it's really fun trying to go through and get them all, they aren't instant achievements and they aren't impossible either, so they aren't useless spam achievements.

I can still play this from time to time and still get enjoyment from playing this for hours on end, I have recently started playing this again and it is still actually really fun to play, and that's why I definitely would recommend it.
